MultipleChoice.Title: Emphasis
MultipleChoice.Instruction: Choose the option which correctly emphasises the sentence example.

Content.Question:
1. She didn’t have the courage to look me in the face.She didn’t have even the courage to look me in the face.
She didn’t even have the courage to look me in the face.

2. The water was cold.The water was very cold indeed.
The water was very cold at all.

3. She isn’t stupid. She just doesn’t listen.She isn’t of the least a bit stupid. She just doesn’t listen.
She isn’t in the least bit stupid. She just doesn’t listen.

4. Charlotte always cleared up all the mess.It was Charlotte who always cleared up all the mess.
It is Charlotte who was always clearing up the mess.

5. It wasn’t easy to find a good job.It was by no means easy to find a good job.
It wasn’t by no means easy to find a good job.

6. The company gave Jane a car.The company gave Jane even her own car.
The company even gave Jane her own car.

7. We need to find someone who can help us.What we need is someone who can help us.
What do we need is someone to help us.

8. I don’t feel well.I don’t feel at all well.
I don’t feel very well indeed.

9. I offered to pay for her ticket.I did offer for pay for her ticket.
I did offer to pay for her ticket.

10. He asked us to leave the room.He actually asked us to leave the room!
He asked us to leave the actually room!
